topic.title: Contact Couchbase
topic.shortdesc: Provide feedback, and get help with any problem you may encounter.

section.title: Options for Making Contact
section.p: You can get in touch with Couchbase in any of the following ways:

li.p: Contact Couchbase Support: If you are a customer of Couchbase Server Enterprise Edition, and have a support contract, you can log into the Couchbase Customer Support Portal, and so make contact with Couchbase staff-members, who will provide guidance and assist with any problems you are encountering. Email and phone support are also available.

Participate in a Forum: Multiple online forums are available, whereby you can post a question, and get answers; both from Couchbase employees and from members of the Couchbase community of developers and administrators.
Submit a ticket: Couchbase provides a publicly available facility, based on JIRA software, that allows any community member to report a defect or anomaly.
Submit documentation changes: If you find errors in Couchbase documentation, you can elect to make your own edits, and directly submit the results to Couchbase.

section.p: Further details of each of these options are provided below.

section.title: Contact Couchbase Support
section.p: The Couchbase Support Portal provides online support to all customers of Couchbase Server Enterprise Edition who have a support contract. Located at https://support.couchbase.com, it provides multiple options for sign-in:
Additionally, you can contact Couchbase Support by phoning +1-650-417-7500, or by sending email to support@couchbase.com.

section.title: Participate in a Forum
section.p: Couchbase Community Forums let you learn and share knowledge about Couchbase products, with other developers, administrators, and Couchbase in-house experts. You do not need to be a Couchbase customer to participate. All forums can be accessed at forums.couchbase.com:

To access individual forums, and thereby view and participate in information-exchanges, select from the all categories pull-down menu. To participate fully, registration is required. Note that this also provides access to free training. Left-click on the Sign Up button, at the upper right.

section.title: Submit a Ticket
section.p: If you have a JIRA account, you can submit a ticket to Couchbase. When submitting, include all information that might be appropriate. For example:

li.p: A description of your environment (package installation, cluster_run, build number, operating system, etc).
All steps required to reproduce the issue.
The full content of design documents.
The command-line expression used to generate submitted data.
All names, parameters, flags, and values for queries performed. Provide sample output in verbose mode for repeated attempts, using different values.
Query-results from the command-line, when failures have occurred through use of the UI; and vice versa.

section.title: Submit Documentation Changes
section.p: If you find a documentation-error, you can left click on the link at the upper right of each page:
This provides an interactive edit-pane, in which the page-source can be directly edited:
When you have made your edits, left-click on the Commit changes button, at the lower left:
This allow you to open a pull request, which will be reviewed by Couchbase staff-members prior to integration into the documentation set.
